answerText: Ntozake Shange [or Paulette Williams][10] Including the poems "Sechita," "Pyramid," and "I Used to Live in the World," this Shange play consists of eight title characters delivering verse monologues, such as one from the "Lady in Red" about Willie Brown killing their children.
heading: VCU Closed |2013 | Editors 2 | 7 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The title character learns that Mrs. Maureen's beauty parlor is actually a front for a brothel in this author's novel about the integration of public schools in St. Louis, Betsey Brown. For 10 points each: [10] Name this writer, who also created the poetry collection Nappy Edges and a play about photographer Sean David choosing among his various lovers, A Photograph.
